title.narrative: UNDP: Support to the Tunisian Parliament

description.narrative: Phase 2 of the UNDP programme focuses on the implementation of the constitution. Activities will include providing technical support to the Tunisian parliament in the development of key organic laws and independent institutions.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative:
Parliament’s capacities in legislation analysis, drafting and amendment for Constitution implementation, including gender equality provisions, are enhanced, and legislative structures are in place.
- at least 60% of MPs benefitting from capacity strengthening in constitutional implementation by the end of 2019 - Committee strategies developed for oversight of legislative and institutional implementation of the new Constitution - National conference on progress of constitutional implementation - National forum on progress of Constitution’s objective in gender equality - Number of amendments proposed/adopted - Establishment of working group on implementation of gender equality provisions - At least 50% of MPs receive training on gender-lens approach - Development of legislative action plan in gender equality - Fulfilment through legislation of the Constitutional gender equality provisions

target.value: - At least 65 MPs receive training on specific areas of constitutional implementation - 2 workshops with MPs on core organic laws (decentralisation) and independent constitutional bodies - 1 Committee strategy for oversight of legislative and institutional implementation of the new Constitution developed - 25 amendments proposed - 10 amendments adopted - Working group on implementation of gender equality provisions

actual.value: 42 were trained 2 workshops were held N/A on comittee strategy N/A on amendments proposed N/A on amendments adopted Working group created

target.value: - 1 workshop with MP on core organic laws and independent constitutional bodies - 1 Committee strategy developed for oversight of legislative and institutional implementation of the new Constitution - At least 32 new MPs receive training on specific areas of constitutional implementation - 25 additional amendments proposed - 10 additional amendments adopted - Legislative action plan in gender equality - 43 MPs receive training on gender approach - national conference on progress of constitutional implementation - national forum on progress of the Constitution’s objectives in gender equality

actual.value: Fulfilled Nearly fulfilled - the COAAFA have the strategic tools to begin Fulfilled - 62 MPs were trained N/A on amendments proposed N/A on amendments adopted N/A Not fulfilled - 11 were trained N/A N/A

target.value: - 25 additional amendments proposed - 10 additional amendments adopted
- 25 additional amendments proposed - 10 additional amendments adopted

- 1 workshop with MP on core organic laws and independent constitutional bodies - At least 32 new MPs receive training on specific areas of constitutional implementation - 25 additional amendments proposed - 10 additional amendments adopted - 32 new MPs receive training on gender approach - A Committee strategy for oversight of legislative and institutional implementation of the new Constitution developed

actual.value: N/A 83 MPs received training N/A on amendments proposed N/A on amendments adopted 62 received training on gender approach N/A

title.narrative:
The new Assembly is equipped with the capacities and the structures enabling it to play its constitutional role effectively and transparently, including through the systematic engagement of citizens in its work.
- Number of MPs receiving training on law-making, representation, oversight, budget, groups, and sustainable national development goals. - Establishment of a working group on the strategic development of the parliament - Development of capacity building strategy on parliamentary oversight - Number of questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - Number of committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and/or experts’ inputs - Establishment of a Parliamentary Budget Unit or comparable resource - number of analytical reports on budget proposals - Increased effectiveness of MPs in the budget cycle as judged by their own and external assessments - Pre-budget auditions of civil society and budget experts - High level dialogue workshops on negoti

target.value: - 20 new MPs receive training on law-making, 20 on representation, 20 on oversight, 20 on budget, 20 on groups, and 20 on sustainable national development goals number of analytical reports on budget proposals - 45 questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - high level dialogue workshop on negotiation and mediation processes in parliament - 30 committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and experts inputs - 1 analytical report on budget proposals

actual.value: 151 MPs received training N/A N/A N/A - however some progress was made with the creation of an institutional charter on the cooperation between ARP and civil societies N/A

target.value: 20 new MPs receive training on law-making, 20 on representation, 20 on oversight, 20 on budget, 20 on groups, and 20 on sustainable national development goals - 30 questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - Productive output of the PBU in terms of budget analysis and responses to member requests in line with approved plan - 20 committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and experts inputs - 1 analytical report on budget proposals

actual.value: 164 MPs received training N/A N/A N/A N/A

target.value: - 50 new MPs receive training on law-making, 50 on representation, 50 on oversight, 50 on budget, 50 on groups, and 50 on sustainable national development goals - Establishment of a working group on the strategic development of the parliament - Parliamentary Budget Unit (PBU) established - 40 questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - high level dialogue workshop on negotiation and mediation processes in parliament - 15 committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and experts inputs - 1 analytical report on budget proposals

actual.value: 47% of MPs received training Not fulfilled N/A N/A Not fulfilled Fulfilled N/A

target.value: - 30 new MPs receive training on law-making, 30 on representation, 30 on oversight, 30 on budget, 30 on groups, and 30 on sustainable national development goals number of analytical reports on budget proposals - 40 questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - high level dialogue workshop on negotiation and mediation processes in parliament - 20 committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and experts inputs - 1 analytical report on budget proposals

actual.value: 71% of the MPs received training 15 studies were sent to parliamentary commissions N/A N/A N/A

target.value: 75 MPs receive training on law-making, on representation, on oversight, on budget, on groups, on sustainable national development goals. - Capacity building strategy on parliamentary oversight developed - 30 questions, interpellations, missions of enquiry - high level dialogue workshop on negotiation and mediation processes in parliament - 10 committee hearings on legislation and oversight receiving civil society and experts inputs - 1 analytical report on budget proposals
